newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares retain soft tone to drift lower at close.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares retain soft tone to drift lower at close.

text.p: * New Zealand shares end lower on light volume
* Profit-takers unmatched by buyers
* Telecom, Fletcher Paper come off lows
Price movements at close
LAST CHG
137 nil * NZSE-40 cap index -9.41 at 2,417.80
336 -1 * NZSC cap index -13.29 at 5,185.87
363 +5 * Volume NZ$37.5 million. Futures -8 at 1,217
752 -2 * Other movers - +10 -14
New Zealand shares ended weaker but off their lows after a sedate Thursday session.
The NZSE-40 Capital Index ended 9.41 points down at 2,417.80 on turnover worth NZ$37.5 million, much of it done late in the session. The index had earlier hit a low of 2,414.88.
Campbell Stuart at SBC Warburg said there was little specific corporate news for the market to react to.
"It certainly felt pretty quiet," he said.
Among the movements, Fletcher Paper lost five cents to close at NZ$2.89 and Telecom lost two to $7.52. Both were marginally off their lows.
Fisher and Paykel was under pressure, losing 14 cents to NZ$5.35. Stuart suggested the whiteware manufacturer may be feeling the pinch of a strong New Zealand dollar.
Clothing retailer Hallenstein Glasson gained four to NZ$2.79, despite earlier reporting that December 1996 sales had fallen 4.6 percent on a same-store basis over December 1995.
Hallenstein's statement did not hold a lot of good news, but it didn't mean seriously bad news either, Stuart said.

"They have proved to be a good quality company over time and a good manager of their stock. While they have probably not had the Christmas they would have liked, they are probably not likely to materially disappoint either," he said.
Among other issues, Cultus Petroleum gained 10 cents to NZ$1.58, a year high.
